intro: Turraeanthus klainei, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Turraeanthus klainei is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils with minimal rainfall.
